content: छाया [छो-ण <ls>Uṇ. 4. 109</ls>] {@--1@} Shade, shadow (changed at the end of <ab>Tat.</ab> <ab>comp.</ab> into छायं when बाहुल्य or thickness of shade is meant; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} इक्षुच्छायनिषादिन्यः <ls>R. 4. 20</ls>; so <ls n="R.">7. 4</ls>, <ls n="R.">12. 50</ls>; <ls>Mu. 4. 21</ls>); छायामधः सानुगतां निषेव्य <ls>Ku. 1. 5</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">6. 46</ls>; अनुभवति हि मूर्ध्ना पादपस्तीव्रमुष्णं शमयति परितापं छायया संश्रितानां <ls>Ś. 5. 7</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 75</ls>, <ls n="R.">2. 6</ls>; <ls n="R.">3. 70</ls>; <ls>Me. 67.</ls> {@--2@} A reflected image, a reflection; छाया न मूर्छति मलोपहतप्रसादे शुद्धे तु दर्पणतले सुलभावकाशा <ls>Ś. 7. 32.</ls> {@--3@} Resemblance, likeness. {@--4@} A shadowy fancy, hallucination. {@--5@} Blending of colours. {@--6@} Lustre, light; छायामंडललक्ष्येण <ls>R. 4. 5</ls>; रत्नच्छायाव्यतिकरः <ls>Me. 15</ls>, <ls n="Me.">35.</ls> {@--7@} Colour; <ls>Māl. 6. 5.</ls> {@--8@} Colour of the face, complexion; केवलं लावण्यमयी छाया त्वां न मुंचति <ls>Ś. 3</ls>; मेघैरंतरितः प्रिये तव मुखच्छायानुकारी शशी <ls>Ś.</ls> D.; <ls>Pt. 5. 88.</ls> {@--9@} Beauty; क्षामच्छायं भवनं <ls>Me. 80</ls>, <ls n="Me.">104.</ls> {@--10@} Protection. {@--11@} A row, line. {@--12@} Darkness. {@--13@} A bribe. {@--14@} <ab>N.</ab> of Durgā. {@--15@} The shadow of a gnomon as indicating the sun's position. {@--16@} The Sun. {@--17@} Nightmare. {@--18@} <ab>N.</ab> of a wife of the sun (she was but a shadow or likeness of संज्ञा, the wife of the Sun; consequently when संज्ञा went to her father's house without the knowledge of her husband, she put छाया in her own place. छाया bore to the Sun three children:--two sons Sāvarṇi and Śani, and one daughter Tapanī). --यः One who grants shade.
